RankDef.description: A devout believer in the Nine Divines who regularly participates in religious ceremonies and supports the Imperial Cult.
A beginning student of the divine mysteries, learning the basic tenets of Imperial religion and temple duties.
A dedicated servant of the temple who assists in daily rituals and tends to the needs of pilgrims and worshippers.
One who has undergone the sacred initiation rites and been formally accepted into the priesthood of the Nine Divines.
An ordained minister of the Imperial Cult, authorized to conduct religious ceremonies, offer blessings, and provide spiritual guidance.
A priest assigned to serve the spiritual needs of the Imperial Legion or other Imperial institutions away from the main temples.
A priest specializing in the divine arts of healing, drawing upon the benevolence of the Divines to mend wounds and cure ailments.
A learned member of the clergy who studies religious texts, maintains temple libraries, and interprets divine doctrine.
A mystically gifted priest who serves as a conduit for divine revelation, offering prophecy and interpreting the will of the Divines.
A senior cleric responsible for overseeing a major temple or region, with authority over local priests and religious activities.
A high-ranking religious leader who governs the Imperial Cult within an entire province, reporting directly to the imperial hierarchy.
A warrior-priest who combines martial prowess with divine magic, serving as both protector of the faith and holy champion.
An elite warrior blessed by the Divines, serving as both temporal and spiritual guardian of Imperial Cult interests.
The supreme religious authority of the Imperial Cult, serving as the voice of the Nine Divines and spiritual advisor to the Emperor.
The ultimate spiritual leader, one who has achieved the highest understanding of divine mysteries and serves as the earthly representative of the Divines.
The chief religious authority of a major region or province, responsible for coordinating multiple temples and religious activities.
A high-ranking priest responsible for maintaining religious orthodoxy and investigating matters of heresy or spiritual corruption.
